name: EARTH AI
headline: Predictive Explorer and Driller for Critical Metal Deposits
description: EARTH AI is a predictive explorer and driller for critical metal deposits. We discovered 5% of the world’s deposits this year, thanks to our AI with 66% vs 0.5% success rate and Low Disturbance Drilling tech which enables 1/4 cheaper and 4X faster site testing.

raw_markdown='[](http://www.earth-ai.com/</>)Menu

  * Explore with us


# Fast-tracking the electric future
Earth AI is a high-performance explorer for clean energy minerals.
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1569'%20width='2481'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/e8a2484729a36c3811b94737350cdfcd/e4a45/home-hero.jpg)
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='806'%20width='984'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/c5e66e1c505263ad42eaf46b4b2bccf3/32dc8/mountain.png)
Source: International Energy Agency, “Key Market Trends”
The path to net zero will be forged with metals.
The transition to a net-zero economy has sparked an explosion in the demand for critical metals. Mineral explorers have embraced the challenge, igniting a fervent race for new discoveries.
While mineral resources have a reputation for being stable long-term commodity business, the significant surge in demand is dictating new rules. Across all segments of the supply chain, the industry stands ready for innovation. We are thrilled to be at the forefront of this revolution.
## Earth AI discovers untapped critical metal deposits at half the cost in a fraction of the time.
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1080'%20width='1920'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/fb9c41353c68612f48ecc96d8d0484a0/8cf01/drill-video-poster.jpg)
Drone footage from Earth AI exploratory drilling site
## Best-In-Class Unit Economics
![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/480d28ccda24f6963df3a0089646d284/icon-bar.svg)
### Lowest Drilling Cost
![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/5e42e5082be49c396a9330e52d26aa13/icon-detection.svg)
### Precise AI-Driven Prospect Detection
![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/9e3f3be850cf46dcbb9ceb4f99a6901e/icon-minimal.svg)
### Minimal Environmental Impact
[Our technology](http://www.earth-ai.com/</technology/>)
## We Help Our Exploration Partners Discover More
Earth AI is dedicated to the success of our partners. We work with high-potential mineral resource companies, helping them improve their odds of success while keeping costs low.
With accurate AI-driven prospect detection, modular hardware, and streamlined operations, Earth AI can move from detecting a prospect to drilling in just three to six months. Our revenue model is independent of service profits, and our process is four times faster than traditional methods.
Once a discovery is made, we partner with explorers and development companies to bring these deposits into production.

Explore with us
## Our Team
At Earth AI, we are decoding complex geology and turbocharging exploration drilling.
We live in the field and love adventure. We’ve built an operation that thrives in the roughest conditions, and we’re lucky to work in the most remote and beautiful landscapes of the world.
Meet the team that is reimagining mineral discovery.

Eventually, after they found all of the obvious stuff, they progressed to doing airborne geophysical surveys that used tools such as electromagnetic sensing to identify minerals that were just below the surface or highly concentrated...Heatmap](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/heatmap.news/technology/earth-ai-series-b>)

Why it matters: Companies need plenty more raw materials to build the engines of the green energy transition. [![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1561.9999999999998'%20width='2082'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/e76c4d647e04ba7bd748cf083322d87b/6a2ca/pasted-graphic-4-7.png)2024.03.18AnnouncementHigh-Grade Lead Identified at Tivan’s Sandover ProjectNew high-grade lead (Pb) target identified at the Sandover Project in the Northern Territory by Tivan’s exploration alliance partner EARTH AI, with up to 12.2% Pb returned from surface rock assays.Tivan ASX Release](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/tivan.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/61196661.pdf>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1708'%20width='2780'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/3af77b6fa85abd4360fa041064c72bc8/33777/legacy-minerals-discovers-magmatic-pge-ni-cu.png)2024.03.18AnnouncementLegacy Minerals Discovers Magmatic PGE-Ni-Cu Through AILegacy Minerals Holdings Limited (ASX: LGM) has received diamond drilling assays by its exploration alliance partner, Earth AI, at the company’s 100% owned Fontenoy Project, NSW. Discovery drillhole, diamond cored EFO7D, returned magmatic-related platinum group elements (PGEs) and Ni-Cu-Fe sulphides: 34m at 0.5g/t 3E PGE 10m at 1.2g/t 3E PGE, 0.2% Ni, and 891ppm Cu from 388m down-holeThe Assay](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/www.theassay.com/news/legacy-minerals-discovers-magmatic-pge-ni-cu-through-ai/>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1288'%20width='1748'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/e68be842780337959f4de5c739e9f34c/40d9e/legacy-minerals.png)2024.03.18AnnouncementArtificial Intelligence makes New Magmatic PGE-Ni-Cu DiscoveryStrategic Partner Earth AI drills discovery hole. Discovery drillhole, diamond cored EFO7D, returned magmatic-related platinum group elements (PGEs) and Ni-Cu-Fe sulphides including and broad zone of mineralisation: o 34m at 0.5g/t 3E PGE* including a higher grade zone of: o 10m at 1.2g/t 3E PGE, 0.2% Ni and 891ppm Cu from 388m down-holeLegacy Minerals ASX Release](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/investorhub.legacyminerals.com.au/announcements/6216639>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1758'%20width='1484'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/3c672767888008771c81e9c953955b15/386d7/pasted-graphic-1.png)2023.11.06ArticleEarth AI mining start-up seeks $20m raise after lucrative deposit findUnlike more the typical use of AI in established mines, with reams of data from pre-drilled holes or geological surveys, EarthAI targets new greenfield environments. It has built an AI model trained on 40 years of geological data from NASA and the National Archives. Founded by geoscientist Roman Teslyuk, EarthAI is now shopping around the fresh molybdenum discovery to mining companies capable of extracting the resource. EarthAI’s business model relies on getting a cut of the mining royalty. As it stands, the start-up has partnerships with Tivan, Kincora Copper, Legacy Minerals and Karawara Minerals.Australian Financial Review](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/www.afr.com/technology/the-tech-deals-you-need-to-know-20230614-p5dgkc>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1568'%20width='2040'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/b17c98eecba7daeca0cb92e21f185dac/dbf45/pasted-graphic.png)2023.11.02ArticleCould AI help find valuable mineral deposits?The future is electric. That means it will need a lot of batteries, motors and wires. That, in turn, means a lot of cobalt, copper, lithium and nickel with which to build them. Great times, then, for prospectors, and particularly for any who think they can increase the efficiency of their profession. Several firms are applying artificial intelligence (ai) to the process, both to improve the odds of surface strikes and to detect underground ore bodies that are invisible to current techniques.The Economist](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/www.economist.com/science-and-technology/2023/11/01/could-ai-help-find-valuable-mineral-deposits?utm_medium=affiliates.offer.pd&utm_source=partnerize-viglink&utm_campaign=a.io&utm_content=conversion.direct-response.anonymous&utm_term=1011lxVYfMnw&partnerize_clickref=1011lxVYfMnw>)

[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='692'%20width='908'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/5b24409daf0ff4f1a4c8a321133013f3/a591d/minjing-magazine-thumb.png)2023.10.26ArticleNew molybdenum deposit discovered using AIMining services provider Earth AI says its software has detected a new porphyry molybdenum deposit in New South Wales, Australia.Mining Magazine](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/www.miningmagazine.com/exploration/news/1461300/new-molybdenum-deposit-discovered-using-ai>)

That means it will need a lot of batteries, motors and wires. That, in turn, means a lot of cobalt, copper, lithium and nickel with which to build them. Great times, then, for prospectors, and particularly for any who think they can increase the efficiency of their profession. Several firms are applying artificial intelligence to the process, both to improve the odds of surface strikes and to detect underground ore bodies that are invisible to current techniques.The West Australian](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/thewest.com.au/business/the-economist/the-economist-could-ai-help-find-valuable-mineral-deposits-c-12485271>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='692'%20width='908'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/026e2bf8449fe9938bf80d5807e175dd/a591d/global-ai-news-thumb.png)2023.10.26ArticleEarth AI Unearths AI-Discovered Greenfield Molybdenum DepositEarth AI, a leading explorer for clean energy metals, has achieved a significant breakthrough by discovering...Global AI News](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/ai-news.global/2023/10/26/earth-ai-unearths-ai-discovered-greenfield-molybdenum-deposit/>)
[![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='400'%20width='640'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/4051d81f8747685bbd546d59635069d6/b6c85/media-small-caps-tivan.webp)2023.03.07AnnouncementTivan teams-up with Earth AI to fast-track discoveries at SandoverTivan (ASX: TVN) has revealed a strategic exploration alliance with Earth AI in relation to the Sandover lithium project, which is 50km south of its Mount Peake critical minerals project in the Northern Territory.Small Caps](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/smallcaps.com.au/tivan-teams-up-earth-ai-fast-track-discoveries-sandover/>)

# Fast-tracking the electric future
Earth AI is a high-performance explorer for clean energy minerals.
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1569'%20width='2481'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/e8a2484729a36c3811b94737350cdfcd/e4a45/home-hero.jpg)
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='806'%20width='984'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/c5e66e1c505263ad42eaf46b4b2bccf3/32dc8/mountain.png)
Source: International Energy Agency, “Key Market Trends”
The path to net zero will be forged with metals.
The transition to a net-zero economy has sparked an explosion in the demand for critical metals. Mineral explorers have embraced the challenge, igniting a fervent race for new discoveries.
While mineral resources have a reputation for being stable long-term commodity business, the significant surge in demand is dictating new rules. Across all segments of the supply chain, the industry stands ready for innovation. We are thrilled to be at the forefront of this revolution.
## Earth AI discovers untapped critical metal deposits at half the cost in a fraction of the time.
![](data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20height='1080'%20width='1920'%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20version='1.1'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Our technology⟨1⟩
## We Help Our Exploration Partners Discover More
Earth AI is dedicated to the success of our partners. We work with high-potential mineral resource companies, helping them improve their odds of success while keeping costs low.
With accurate AI-driven prospect detection, modular hardware, and streamlined operations, Earth AI can move from detecting a prospect to drilling in just three to six months. Our revenue model is independent of service profits, and our process is four times faster than traditional methods.
Once a discovery is made, we partner with explorers and development companies to bring these deposits into production.

## Our Team
At Earth AI, we are decoding complex geology and turbocharging exploration drilling.
We live in the field and love adventure. We’ve built an operation that thrives in the roughest conditions, and we’re lucky to work in the most remote and beautiful landscapes of the world.
Meet the team that is reimagining mineral discovery.

![⟨15⟩![](http://www.earth-ai.com)![](http://www.earth-ai.com/static/3c672767888008771c81e9c953955b15/386d7/pasted-graphic-1.png)2023.11.06ArticleEarth AI mining start-up seeks $20m raise after lucrative deposit findUnlike more the typical use of AI in established mines, with reams of data from pre-drilled holes or geological surveys, EarthAI targets new greenfield environments. It has built an AI model trained on 40 years of geological data from NASA and the National Archives. Founded by geoscientist Roman Teslyuk, EarthAI is now shopping around the fresh molybdenum discovery to mining companies capable of extracting the resource. EarthAI’s business model relies on getting a cut of the mining royalty. As it stands, the start-up has partnerships with Tivan, Kincora Copper, Legacy Minerals and Karawara Minerals.Australian Financial Review](http://www.earth-ai.com/<https:/www.afr.com/technology/the-tech-deals-you-need-to-know-20230614-p5dgkc>)

generated_description:
**Earth AI: Pioneering the Future of Mineral Exploration**

Founded in 2016 and hailing from San Francisco, Earth AI is transforming the landscape of mineral exploration with its cutting-edge predictive technologies. The company specializes in locating critical metal deposits essential for our transitioning electric future, leveraging artificial intelligence to dramatically improve discovery success rates.

### Mission and Achievements
Earth AI aims to be the premier predictive explorer and driller for critical metal deposits. In just a year, they've achieved a staggering milestone, identifying 5% of the world’s metal deposits with an impressive success rate of 66%, compared to the industry standard of 0.5%. Their innovative Low Disturbance Drilling technology allows for site testing that is not only 25% cheaper but also four times faster than traditional methods.

### Technology at the Forefront
The backbone of Earth AI's operations is its AI-driven prospect detection technology. This methodology enables them to move from detection to drilling within three to six months, all while minimizing environmental impact. Their approach allows for a much faster turnover and lowers costs, which is crucial in a time when demand for clean energy minerals is surging.

### Team and Backing
With a lean team of 12, Earth AI is driven by a group of highly skilled professionals led by founder and CEO Roman Teslyuk. They are backed by prominent investors including Y Combinator, which highlights their credibility and potential in the market.

### Strategic Partnerships
Earth AI thrives on collaboration. They have formed strategic alliances with notable mining companies like Tivan and Kincora Copper, aiming to enhance mineral discovery through shared expertise and resources. Their partnerships focus on various mineral projects ranging from lithium to copper, addressing the increasing global demand for clean energy technologies.

### The Future is Bright
The transition to a net-zero economy is catalyzing an unprecedented demand for metals. As industries pivot towards sustainable solutions, the role of companies like Earth AI becomes vital. With their commitment to innovation and successful track record, they stand poised to lead in the quest for new mineral resources that will power our future.

For more information on their initiatives and technology, visit [Earth AI](http://www.earth-ai.com).
